column4: does anybody know of a good howto on dual head with ATI 9600xt ?
does 'sudo aptitude install xorg-driver-fglrx && sudo aticonfig --initial=dual-head --screen-layout=left' work?
didn't know of that, trying now
after running that apt-get command for dual head i get this message : sudo: aticonfig: command not found
ahh, are you running dapper or breezy?
make a copy of /etc/X11/xorg.conf in your home directory and run 'sudo fglrxconfig'
64 bits breezy, dunno if that's relevant
the config tool for ATI is a bit improved in dapper :)
i did a dist-upgrade from hoary to badger yesteday, do you think it's better to upgrade to dapper ?
not better, just different :)
you can get it to work in Breezy too, the combined effort of upgrading to Dapper and configuring the card is probably greater
hmmm that didn't work :(
still the same on both monitors
hmm, did fglrxconfig finish okay? (and did you select all of the dual-head stuff?)
if you did that okay, do 'ls /etc/X11' and see if there's a file named XF86Config or XF86Config-4
bingo :) unless that's the copy you made, copy it over /etc/X11/xorg.conf
the one in etc/x11 is the most recent one
ah :/ what happens if you 'grep fglrx /etc/X11/xorg.conf'?
xorg.conf contains that word
hmm, that's all I can really walkthrough, http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=423584 is good, when the forums come back
ok thanks
ok, thanks. I guess i have to look into it then
